Bleed Layouts

The bleed attribute allows layouts to extend beyond their container to full viewport width.
Useful for hero sections, banners, and full-width content within constrained containers.

Basic Bleed

Full-width layout that bleeds to viewport edges.

Full Bleed

Layout extends to full viewport width <lay-out md="columns(1)" bleed>

Bleed with Columns

Multi-column layout at full width <lay-out md="columns(2)" bleed>

Bleed with Width Constraint

Bleed layouts can have a max-width while still using full-width background.

Bleed + Width MD

Content constrained to md width, background bleeds <lay-out md="columns(2)" bleed width="md">

Bleed + Width LG

Content constrained to lg width, background bleeds <lay-out md="columns(2)" bleed width="lg">

Asymmetric Bleed

Use a percentage value to offset the content asymmetrically.

Bleed 10%

Content shifted 10% toward start <lay-out md="columns(1)" bleed="10">

Bleed 25%

Content shifted 25% toward start <lay-out md="columns(1)" bleed="25">

Bleed -15% (negative)

Content shifted toward end <lay-out md="columns(1)" bleed="-15">

Bleed with Padding

Add inline padding to bleed layouts.

Bleed + Padding

Full bleed with internal padding <lay-out md="columns(2)" bleed pad-inline="2">
